title: Strengthening Customer Service Practical Competencies: Workshop on Designing and Developing Serious Games for Science Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Game Design Principles and Foundational Knowledge in Educational Technology
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Using problem-based learning (PBL), learners can identify and explain at least three core design elements of science-integrated serious games.
Learners can develop a prototype of a mini-game for science education by applying game-based learning theories (e.g., situated learning theory).

Learners can analyze the educational effectiveness of serious games they developed through peer assessment using five or more evaluation criteria (e.g., achievement of learning objectives, interactivity).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
